definition: to fail to achieve something/to be fruitless
to fail/to fall through/to come to nothing
to omit/to neglect
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time
hopes are dashed

sentences.english: entered into an advertising dalliance with Google, but this fell apart after antitrust authorities signalled that they would not approve such an agreement.
sentences.chinese: 但是因反托马斯当局的不赞成，他们的联盟落空。

sentences.english: But a strong Volcker Rule just might take the cake away.
sentences.chinese: 但强硬的沃尔克法则却会让这个美梦落空。

sentences.english: If couldn t hand in the finished product, he wishes will be dashed.
sentences.chinese: 届时若交不出成品，兰博士的心愿就要落空了。
战争使人们对和平的希望落空了。

sentences.english: A good goal will never failed because of the slowly.
sentences.chinese: 一个好的目标决不会因为慢慢来而落空。

sentences.english: If this fails to happen then it may be euro positive as the markets re-adjust.
sentences.chinese: 如果预期落空，则市场重新调整的力量或提振欧元。

sentences.english: But hopes for a breakthrough have been frustrated by poor implementation.
sentences.chinese: 然而，执行不力令突破现状的希望落空。

sentences.english: Her refusal to help quite upset the applecart.
sentences.chinese: 她不肯帮忙，计划也就落空了。

sentences.english: It’s easy to admire his aspiration, but his hopes were all dashed.
sentences.chinese: 他的抱负很容易得到钦佩，但他的希望全部落空了。

sentences.english: Again, we may make compromises and fall between two stools.
sentences.chinese: 我们可能再一次采取妥协办法，但结果是两头落空。

sentences.english: Think Lana let she lost a daughter, SuNi and let her lost will.
sentences.chinese: 以为拉娜让她落空了女儿，苏妮又让她落空威尔。

sentences.english: Think Lana let she lost a daughter, SuNi and let her lost will.
sentences.chinese: 以为拉娜让她落空了女儿，苏妮又让她落空威尔。

sentences.english: Itnever did, and there are no Alabama sturgeons in captivity.
sentences.chinese: 但人们的希望落空了，阿拉巴马鲟鱼再也没有出现过。

sentences.english: What if a bunch of other things get cancelled or fall through?
sentences.chinese: 万一有什么别的事取消或落空了呢？

sentences.english: Hit-and-run Bible reading can often become hit and miss.
sentences.chinese: 打带跑的阅读圣经，经常带来挥棒落空的结果。

sentences.english: A defeat in the election disappointed our original plans.
sentences.chinese: 选举失败使我们的原计划落空。

definition: lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
to be shattered/to be annihilated (of hope, illusions etc)
hopes are dashed
to come to nothing (idiom)
to stop/to pull back
counting one's chickens before they are hatched
to hit (a target etc)/to strike
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
(not of regular commerce) to sell or dispose of (goods etc)/to get rid of/to unload
to smash to pieces
to prevail/to have one's way/to get away with it
lit. froth and shadows/fig. illusion/mirage
to cut off/to chop sth in half
to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
to defeat/to smash/to rout
